name: Classical Mechanics
description: This course introduces students to the principles of classical mechanics, including kinematics, forces, work, energy, motion of systems of particles, collisions, rotational motion, and fluid mechanics.

name: Electromagnetism
description: This course introduces students to the principles of electromagnetism, such as electric and magnetic fields, electric potential, Gauss's Law, Ampere's Law, Faraday's Law, Lenz's Law, Maxwell's equations, and electromagnetic waves.

name: Quantum Mechanics
description: This course introduces students to the principles of quantum mechanics, such as wave-particle duality, Schr√∂dinger equation, uncertainty principle, quantum states and operators, angular momentum, hydrogen atom, and quantum mechanics of systems with identical particles.

name: Thermodynamics and Statistical Mechanics
description: This course introduces students to the principles of thermodynamics and statistical mechanics, including laws of thermodynamics, thermodynamic potentials, heat engines, ideal gases, kinetic theory of gases, Maxwell-Boltzmann distribution, and statistical thermodynamics.

name: Special Relativity
description: This course introduces students to the principles of special relativity, including Lorentz transformations, time dilation, length contraction, relativistic energy and momentum, and relativistic mechanics.

name: General Relativity
description: This course introduces students to the principles of general relativity, such as equivalence principle, curvature of spacetime, geodesics, black holes, and cosmology.

name: Nuclear Physics
description: This course introduces students to the principles of nuclear physics, including nuclear structure, radioactive decay, nuclear reactions, and nuclear astrophysics.

name: Particle Physics
description: This course introduces students to the principles of particle physics, including elementary particles, the standard model, and particle interactions.

name: High Energy Physics
description: This course introduces students to the principles of high energy physics, including experimental techniques, accelerator physics, and particle detectors, as well as current research and open questions in the field.
